>When asked, “How could you possibly have done the first interactive graphics program, the first non-procedural programming language, the first object oriented software system, all in one year?” Ivan replied: “Well, I didnt know it was hard.”

— via Alan Kay, Doing with Images Makes Symbols, 1987

**Little excerpt**

An approach to interfaces in which a network of transformations, constraints, preferences, and other relations connect object(s) of interest to an interface surrogate. The system as a whole is responsible for resolving the arbitrary and complex relationship between an object and surrogate and bridging that surrogate representation to a representation which is observable to users.
